metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0471 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Directory traversal vulnerability in the unpacking functionality in dpkg before 1.15.9, 1.16.x before 1.16.13, and 1.17.x before 1.17.8 allows remote attackers to write arbitrary files via a crafted source package, related to "C-style filename quoting."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0471` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dpkg - 1.17.5ubuntu5.1
dselect - 1.17.5ubuntu5.1
libdpkg-perl - 1.17.5ubuntu5.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> regression fix released as USN-2183-2

criterions.comment: dpkg package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.17.5ubuntu5.1').
